Rejected. It is commonly accepted that the Neolithic occupation is Epicardial 5000-4700 BC, see: 'Nicod, P. Y., Picavet, R., Argant, J., Brochier, J. L., Chaix, L., Delhon, C., ... & Thiébault, S. (2008). La bergerie néolithique de la Grande Rivoire. Premiers bergers des Alpes de la préhistoire al’Antiquité. Musée Dauphinois, Infolio, Gollion, 75-79.'

This is a duplicate with Ly-3504 from Neonet

This date ( = OxA-13661 in Tab. 8 of Mannino, M. A., & Thomas, K. D. (2007). New radiocarbon dates for hunter-gatherers and early farmers in Sicily. Accordia Research Papers, 10, 13-34.) should be eliminated. Within the thèse of C. Collina Neolithic Impressa layers would be dated between 5900 and 5800 cal BC. Later Early Neolithic phases, in Trench A, are documented since 5700 cal BCE (P-2733 6750 +- 70) (Stentinello facies).
